sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The whatcolorback function is used to determine the current background color. The alternate spelling is whatcolourback.
sections.text_content: The whatcolorback function is used to determine the current background color. The alternate spelling is whatcolourback.
sections.mdown_content: The **whatcolorback** function is used to determine the current background color. The alternate spelling is **whatcolourback**.

sections.title: Example
code:
setscreen ("screen")
        Â…
        put "The background of this writing"
        put  "is in color number ", whatcolorback
sections.raw_content: This program outputs the currently-active background color number. The background color of the message is determined by this number.
sections.text_content: This program outputs the currently-active background color number. The background color of the message is determined by this number.
sections.mdown_content: This program outputs the currently-active background color number. The background color of the message is determined by this number.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: The screen should be in a "screen" or "graphics" mode. Beware that the meaning of background color is different in these two modes. See colorback for details.
sections.text_content: The screen should be in a "screen" or "graphics" mode. Beware that the meaning of background color is different in these two modes. See colorback for details.
sections.mdown_content: The screen should be in a "_screen_" or_ _"_graphics_" mode. Beware that the meaning of background color is different in these two modes. See **colorback** for details.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content:
color and whatcolor.

See also predefined unit Text.
